thread.title: Stick to it: All four Midcoast squads qualify for postseason
thread.title_full: Stick to it: All four Midcoast squads qualify for postseason

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Stick to it: All four Midcoast squads qualify for postseason
text:
Stick to it: All four Midcoast squads qualify for postseason Belfast, Mount View clinch quarterfinal berths, Oceanside, Camden Hills to play prelims By Staff | Oct 15, 2015 
The regular season wound to a close for high school field hockey teams on Wednesday, Oct. 14, a scenario that proved positive news for Belfast, Oceanside, Mount View and Camden Hills squads. 
All four qualified for the playoffs in their Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings and regions as the Lions, Windjammers and Mariners made it in Class B North and the Mustangs in Class C North. 
The preliminary playoff round will begin on Saturday, Oct. 17 and the quarterfinal round on Tuesday, Oct. 20. 
The following is a breakdown of the Midcoast teams and their first-round playoff matches: 
In Class B North, Belfast (11-3, 118.6735 points) finished sixth, Camden Hills (7-7, 45.7143 points) eighth and Oceanside (5-8-1, 28.0357 points) 10th. Gardiner (12-2, 134.0816 points) finished first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, the Lions, Windjammers and Mariners qualified for postseason play. 
In prelim playoff action, No. 8 Camden Hills will host No. 9 John Bapst of Bangor (3-10-1, 33.2908 points) on Saturday, Oct. 17 at 11 a.m. The Windjammers and Crusaders do not play each other during the regular season. 
The winner will advance to the quarterfinals to face the top-seeded Tigers. The Windjammers fell to the Tigers 1-0 Oct. 6 in Gardiner. 
In another prelim playoff, No. 10 Oceanside will play at No. 7 Nokomis of Newport (9-5, 85.1531 points) on Saturday, Oct. 17 at 10 a.m in Newport. The Mariners fell to the Warriors 2-1 Sept. 24 in Rockland. 
The winner will advance to the quarterfinals to face No. 2 Winslow (10-3-1, 133.5459 points). The Black Raiders and Mariners played to a scoreless tie Sept. 22 in Rockland. 
The sixth-seeded Lions will play at No. 3 Foxcroft Academy of Dover-Foxcroft (12-2, 127.3980 points) in a quarterfinal playoff game, likely on Wednesday, Oct. 21. The Lions and Ponies do not play each other during the regular season. 
In Class C North, Mount View (9-5, 96.8367 points) finished third, while Dexter (12-2, 130.4082 points) finished first in the 11-team region. The top eight teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, the Mustangs have qualified for postseason play. 
The third-seeded Mustangs will host No. 6 Stearns of Millinocket (8-6) in a quarterfinal playoff game Wednesday, Oct. 21 at 3 p.m. in Thorndike. The Mustangs and Minutemen do not play each other during the regular season.
